title: 2 Simple Ways to Find and Watch Live Streams on YouTube

steps.title: Open the YouTube app.
steps.content: Open the YouTube app. This looks like a red-and-white play button. If you aren't already logged in, tap the profile icon in the bottom-right corner to do so now. YouTube is available for iOS in the App Store and for Android in the Google Play Store . This method will also work on Smart TVs and consoles.

steps.title: Tap the compass icon.
steps.content: Tap the compass icon. You can find this in the top-left corner, below the YouTube logo. A side menu will open. [1] X Research source On Smart TVs and consoles, select ☰ .

steps.title: Select Live.
steps.content: Select Live . This will be between Movies & TV and Gaming .

steps.title: Select a live video to watch it.
steps.content: Select a live video to watch it. It will begin playing. You'll see sections for Live Now , Recent Live Streams , Upcoming Live Streams , and more. Select View all next to the header to expand the videos for that section. When you subscribe to someone and have their alerts enabled, you'll be notified when they go live.

steps.title: Go to https://www.youtube.com in a web browser.
steps.content: Go to https://www.youtube.com in a web browser. If you aren't already logged in, click Sign in in the top-right corner to do so now. This helps personalize the recommended live streams.

steps.title: Click ☰.
steps.content: Click ☰ . This will be in the top-left corner. A side menu will open. If this is already open, skip this step.

steps.title: Click Live.
steps.content: Click Live . You'll see this in the menu on the left side of the page, under the Explore header.

steps.title: Click a live video to watch it.
steps.content: Click a live video to watch it. It will begin playing. You'll see sections for Live Now , Recent Live Streams , Upcoming Live Streams , and more. Click View all next to the header to expand the videos for that section. A chat will appear below the stream. To interact with the chat , it must be set to public (or you must be a subscriber of the YouTuber). Type your text, and press Enter .
